calculations

Class RadialDF

  • java.lang.Object
    • calculations.RadialDF

  • public class RadialDF
extends java.lang.Object
    Calculates a radial distribution function for a system, and has support for averaging over many different configurations. Version 1.1 fixes a major bug in the calculation of the distances between atoms where it would only use the 0 indexed central atom after the current atom index reached the current atom size.
    Version:
    1.1
    Author:
    Trevor Fisher

    • Method Detail

      • rDFCalculation

        public void rDFCalculation(int atomIndex,
                           int[] distances)
        Adds to an array of radial shells extending from atomIndex
        Parameters:
        atomIndex - The atom treated as r1
        distances - Iterates each section by 1 if a distance falls within that shell radius

      • systemRDFCalculation

        public void systemRDFCalculation(java.lang.String centerAtom,
                                 java.lang.String otherAtom,
                                 BulkSystem currentSystem,
                                 int[] distances,
                                 double cutoff)
        Calculates the RDF for each atom in the system.
        Parameters:
        centerAtom - The central atom type for a RDF calculation
        otherAtom - The type of atom that will be measured for the distance from the centerAtom
        currentSystem - The current configuration holding all the atoms within it.
        distances - Keeps track of the number of distance calculations that falls within each RDF shell.
        cutoff - The maximum distance that the RDF function will calculate. Note that this should be half the length of the smallest system box side at most.

      • normalizeRDF

        public double[] normalizeRDF(int[] distances,
                             int numGoodIterations)
        Normalizes the relative density for each RDF shell to the system density. Should be used after all configurations have been tallied in distances.
        Parameters:
        distances - Keeps track of the number of distance calculations that falls within each RDF shell.
        numGoodIterations - The number of configurations that were tallied using systemRDFCalculation.
        Returns:
        An array containing the relative density for each RDF shell.

      • normalizeRDF

        public double[] normalizeRDF(int[] distances)
        Normalizes the relative density for each RDF shell to the system density. Assumes only one configuration was tallied.
        Parameters:
        distances - Keeps track of the number of distance calculations that falls within each RDF shell.
        Returns:
        An array containing the relative density for each RDF shell.

      • periodicDistance

        private double periodicDistance(Atom a,
                                Atom b)
        Calculates the distance between two atoms, accounting for periodic conditions.
        Parameters:
        a - Atom a
        b - Atom b
        Returns:
        The radial distance between the two atoms

        private double getSimulationVolume()

      • getShellVolume

        private static double getShellVolume(int count,
                                     double increment)
        Calculates the volume of a specific RDF shell.
        Parameters:
        count - The shell ordered in increased distance from the central atom.
        increment - The radius of each shell.
        Returns:
        The volume of an RDF shell.

      • getAtomDensity

        private double getAtomDensity()
        Returns:
        The atomic density of a simulation box.
